title: Religion Act 1580
text:
The Religion Act 1580 (23 Eliz.1 c. 1) was an <a href="Act%20of%20Parliament">Act</a> of the <a href="Parliament%20of%20England">Parliament of England</a> during the <a href="English%20Reformation">English Reformation</a>.
The Act made it <a href="high%20treason">high treason</a> to persuade English subjects to withdraw their allegiance to the Queen, or from the <a href="Church%20of%20England">Church of England</a> to Rome, or to promise obedience to a foreign authority.
The Act also increased the fine for absenteeism from Church to £20 a month or imprisonment until they conformed. Finally, the Act fined and imprisoned those who celebrated the <a href="Mass%20%28liturgy%29">mass</a> and attended a mass.
